explanation: [0-0] A green sausage stuffer sits on a white countertop in a room with a white bowl containing white sausage casings placed beneath it. A bouquet of yellow flowers can be seen in the background.

[0-3] Next, a pair of hands takes the sausage casing from the bowl and fits it onto the nozzle of the sausage stuffer, which already has a section of filled sausage protruding from it. The sausage has a deep red color. The hands then pull the casing upwards, ensuring it is completely fitted over the nozzle, and gently squeeze it. The sausage meat can then be seen being filled into the casing.

[0-3] Next, a pair of hands takes the sausage casing from the bowl and fits it onto the nozzle of the sausage stuffer, which already has a section of filled sausage protruding from it. The sausage has a deep red color. The hands then pull the casing upwards, ensuring it is completely fitted over the nozzle, and gently squeeze it. The sausage meat can then be seen being filled into the casing.

The sausage has a deep red color. The hands then pull the casing upwards, ensuring it is completely fitted over the nozzle, and gently squeeze it. The sausage meat can then be seen being filled into the casing.

[3-6] The scene then switches to a person wearing an apron using a green sausage stuffer to make sausages. The person is wearing transparent gloves and using their right hand to feed the meat filling into the machine while their left hand cranks the handle. The nozzle of the machine is extruding sausage meat. A bouquet of sunflowers and a red tomato can be seen in the background. A wooden, checkered cutting board is placed beneath the casing with a section of filled sausage already coiled on it. The person then rapidly cranks the handle with their left hand, and the meat from above is continuously filled into the casing below.

[6-9] Subsequently, the camera zooms in on the wooden, checkered cutting board where the sausage has been filled into a large coil and rests. The sausage maker continues to use the machine to fill the sausage, pressing firmly on the container of meat above with their right hand and rapidly cranking the handle with their left. As the person works, the sausage casing becomes nearly full, and the filled sausage is coiled on the cutting board.
